definition: cautious/prudent
wing/area surrounding the bullseye of a target/to assist/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy/old variant of 翌
surname Yi/alternative name for 絳|绛[Jiang4] capital of the Jin State during the Spring and Autumn Period (770-475 BC)
wing/area surrounding the bullseye of a target/to assist/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy/old variant of 翌
surname Yi/alternative name for 絳|绛[Jiang4] capital of the Jin State during the Spring and Autumn Period (770-475 BC)
cautious and solemn (idiom); very carefully/prudent/gently and cautiously

sentences.english: Yet evidence abounds that banks are still gun-shy about lending to business.
sentences.chinese: 但是诸多证据显示银行对企业贷款仍是小心翼翼。

sentences.english: I walked carefully down to the front and sat beside them.
sentences.chinese: 我小必翼翼地走到前面坐在了他们的旁边。

sentences.english: Cheng give it to G, G put it in the briefcase.
sentences.chinese: 郑小心翼翼地递给朱，朱把它装进公文包。

sentences.english: Believe in me . I will take care of your fragile heart .
sentences.chinese: 相信我，我会小心翼翼去呵护你那易碎的心。

sentences.english: Cautiously, I walked around to the director’s side of the car.
sentences.chinese: 我小心翼翼地绕着理事长的车边走动。

sentences.english: He pronounced each word carefully and all by itself.
sentences.chinese: 他说话时小心翼翼一字一顿的。

sentences.english: He paid for two tickets as circumspectly as possible.
sentences.chinese: 他小心翼翼地付了两张票的钱。

sentences.english: we were meticulous in cleaning the car, washing and polishing every inch of it.
sentences.chinese: 我们小心翼翼地清洗汽车，将每一寸都冲洗和打蜡。

sentences.english: Madeleine placed it carefully in the rocky niche.
sentences.chinese: 玛德琳小心翼翼地把它放在岩石壁龛里。

sentences.english: I looked around carefully. There was not a lion in sight.
sentences.chinese: 我小心翼翼向周围望了望，没看到有狮子。

sentences.english: Each careful step along the byway.
sentences.chinese: 在偏颇的路上小心翼翼地踏步。

sentences.english: So he spent the next four hours painstakingly working with clay to make a tiny bike.
sentences.chinese: 于是他花了四个小时小心翼翼地用黏土做微型脚踏车。

sentences.english: Pretty soon a truck carne, and carried it away carefully.
sentences.chinese: 不久便来了车，小心翼翼地将它运走了。

sentences.english: Or we sit at a table with small tea carefully poured.
sentences.chinese: 或者，我们坐在桌子旁，小心翼翼地斟上一小杯茶。

sentences.english: He carefully picked up his pole. He felt his heart pounding.
sentences.chinese: 他小心翼翼地拿起撑竿，只觉得心怦怦在跳。

sentences.english: They were careful not to offend his nibs .
sentences.chinese: 他们小心翼翼，不敢冒犯这位大人。

definition: cautious and solemn (idiom); very carefully/prudent/gently and cautiously
cautious and timid (idiom); prudent/careful
to be careful/to take care
trembling with fear/with fear and trepidation
to fear/afraid/extremely nervous/for fear that/to avoid/so as not to
shaking with fear
in fear and trepidation (idiom); in reverence before your majesty (court formula of humility)
for fear that/lest/also written 唯恐
to take precautions/to guard against (emergency)
for fear that/lest/also written 惟恐
very slow
to guard against/to be vigilant/watch you don't (slip)/also pr. [ti2 fang2]
very slow/exasperatingly slow
leisurely/unhurried/sluggish
vigilant/cautious
(saying) to be very scared and on edge
